title: Administer Integration Studio
content:
This page describes various Integration Studio administration settings.

Tenant Admin tasks

Configure integration execution history retention period

You can configure for how long (in days) the Integration Studio keeps the execution logs for integrations that use the REST Executor 2.0 endpoints. Enter a value between 1 and 90. If a value less than the minimum (1) or greater than the maximum (90) is entered, the system keeps the logs for 1 or 90 days, respectively. The default value is 30.

The setting is located at Administration > Application Settings.

Suite Admin tasks

Configure Proxy

To connect to the target system specified by the endpoint through a proxy server, configure the proxy server.

The configuration is done in different places, depending on whether you are configuring an agent-based or agent-less integration.

  • For agent-less integrations, configure the proxy server in the Suite Administration portal (Configurations > Proxy settings).
  • For agent-based integrations, you might need to configure a proxy server for either or both of the following communication paths.
    • From the local (Service Management) system to the OPB server: During OPB installation or by using a command line tool.
    • From the OPB server to the target system: By updating the wrapper-custom.conf configuration file.

Configure Throttling

To prevent the Integration Studio from overloading Service Management or the target system, a suite admin can set the following throttling parameters in the Suite Administration portal (Tenants > Select a tenant > Application settings).

Setting Description
Maximum rule execution rate
(for current Service Management and for target system)		 Set the maximum number of Integration Studio rules that can be processed in a minute against Service Management or the target system, respectively. If many rules are triggered simultaneously, newly arriving rules that exceed this limit will be held in a queue for delayed execution to avoid negative performance impact. The allowed range is 100-10,000.
Maximum request processing rate for listener Set the maximum number of requests from external systems that can be processed by the listener per minute. The listener triggers a configured integration scenario for each of the requests. If many requests are received simultaneously, new requests that exceed this limit will be rejected. The allowed range is 10-1,000.
Maximum request processing rate for synchronous scenario triggering Set the maximum number of synchronous scenario triggering requests that can be processed by Integration Studio per minute. If many requests are received simultaneously, new requests that exceed this limit will be rejected. The allowed range is 10-10,000.
Maximum wait duration in seconds for synchronous scenario triggering request Set the maximum duration in seconds that Integration Studio will wait for a response from a synchronous scenario triggering request. The allowed range is 3-30.
Maximum number of iterations for Do Until rules

Set the maximum number of times that the rules inside any Do Until rule can be executed. The range is 10-10000. When the iteration limit is reached, the system will stop executing further iterations for the Do Until rule and write an error in the rule's execution log.

Change the default value for various limits

You can change the default value for the following limits.

Maximum number of rules to be run per scenario

This limit is imposed mainly to prevent system overloading caused by loop action rules. The default value is 100,000. You can perform the following steps to change the default:

  1. Log in to a control plane node or the bastion node as root or a sudo user.

  2. Run the following command:

    kubectl set env deployment/itom-sma-xie-deployment MAX_TASK_RUNNING_COUNT=<new value> -n <namespace>

    Replace <new value> and <namespace> with the actual limit value and the namespace.

Maximum payload size acceptable by the Listener

The default value is 100MB. You can perform the following steps to change the default:

  1. Log in to a control plane node or the bastion node as root or a sudo user.

  2. Run the following command:

    kubectl patch ingress itom-sma-xie-ingress -p '{"metadata": {"annotations": {"ingress.kubernetes.io/proxy-body-size": "<new-value>"}}}' -n <namespace>

    Replace <new value> and <namespace> with the actual limit value and the namespace. Limit value examples: 200m, 3000m.

Maximum execution time for each DSL statement

The default value is five seconds. You can perform the following steps to change the default:

  1. Log in to a control plane node or the bastion node as root or a sudo user.
  2. Run the following command:   
    kubectl set env deployment/itom-sma-xie-deployment DSL_EXECUTE_TIMEOUT=<new value> -n <namespace>
     

     

    Replace <new value> and <namespace> with the actual limit value and the namespace.
